ygData.subject: RE: [cantera] perfectly stirred reactor
ygData.msgSnippet: It is definitely possible to simulate a PSR (or CSTR, continuously stirred tank reactor ) using Cantera. The procedure is admittedly not obvious, since there

It is definitely possible to simulate a PSR (or CSTR, "continuously
stirred tank reactor") using Cantera. The procedure is admittedly not
obvious, since there is no manual yet describing these capabilities. I
have put an example CSTR C++ program in the "Files" section of this
site, in folder "C++ examples". 

Cantera takes a somewhat different approach than most other similar
packages. A CSTR is constructed from predefined components - a reactor
body, an upstream reservoir supplying the reactants, a mass flow
controller, and a pressure regulator. You can create more complex
reactors in the same way, or create multiple connected reactors, each
with its own reaction mechanism. 

The example program is in C++, and for now you can only do this in C++.
Before long I plan to add these capabilities to the Python and MATLAB
interfaces, which will make it much easier to do simulations of CSTRs
and similar reactors.


Dave Goodwin
